meanings.definition: The threshold of a physiological or psychological response.
meanings.sent1: When the music reached the limen, she couldn't help but start dancing.
meanings.sent2: The limen of pain for him was quite high, so he rarely complained.
meanings.sent3: At the limen of hunger, he turned into a cookie monster!
meanings.sent4: The limen between reality and dreams blurred as she fell asleep.
meanings.sent5: Crossing the limen of fear, he finally faced his phobia head-on.

meanings.definition: The point at which a stimulus is of sufficient intensity to produce a response.
meanings.sent1: The limen of the alarm clock woke her up every morning.
meanings.sent2: The limen of the teacher's voice made the students pay attention.
meanings.sent3: The limen of the joke was so low that everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The limen of excitement was reached when the roller coaster started its descent.
meanings.sent5: The limen of the movie's climax left everyone on the edge of their seats.

meanings.sent1: The limen of the property was marked by a tall fence.
meanings.sent2: She reached the limen of her patience and finally spoke up.
meanings.sent3: The limen of the game was where the players had to stop.
meanings.sent4: The limen of the forest seemed to stretch endlessly into the distance.
meanings.sent5: The limen of the law was clear, and he knew not to cross it.
